channel.title: French Project
channel.description: Alright I have a project do tomorrow about traditions of french speaking countries besides France. I am doing Africa, which i didn't even know parts of Africa spoke French. Anyway i need to know how they celebrate Christmas opposed from regular French tradition. It doesn't even need to be opposed from what France does it just needs to be different from the normal U.S tradition. Can some one help me find a website i would use to find the information about french speaking parts of Africa and their Christmas traditions. (I tried google-ing it, but i couldn't find anything. Thank you

item.description:
@Java_Is_So_Cool wrote:

They speak French in the southern area of Africa.

item.dc:creator: @teufel teufel
item.description:
@teufel wrote:

I mean no racism or nativism in my post, I just think its fucked up that they can just walk into our country and now we need to make Spanish our secondary language to make them happy?

I am 100% German and Im not asking for German to be a second language.

item.title: French Project
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“teufel, post:10, topic:373181”][quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=469198.msg3430691#msg3430691 date=1292300946]
Just like America’s second language is (Spanish) correct?
[/quote]

Hell no, that isn’t official and never will be. That is a myth caused by all the illeagle Mexican aliens that won’t learn English. Everyone will be outraged if it became a second language.[/quote]
It is the second language because after Americans, it’s Mexicans. Just basing it off how much people we have at least.

P.S. - I’m Mexican
P.S.S - We’re not the only illegal ones.

Read full topic

item.title: French Project
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“ChaosPkers, post:7, topic:373181”][quote author=k0 twin link=topic=469198.msg3430495#msg3430495 date=1292289799]

[quote author=rip4d link=topic=469198.msg3430477#msg3430477 date=1292289123]

They speak french in Vietnam quite a bit.
[/quote]Not sure if serious.

Anyways, iirc a lot of western African countries had some French speaking parts. Just Google “French speaking African countries.”

They don’t speak it so much anymore, but yes they used to quite a bit and some of the older generations still do today. They were a french colony. And I thinks so was cambodia…? I might be wrong there.
[/quote]i heard canada does too in some parts? just what i heard[/quote]

Yes, that’s Canada’s second language, Just like America’s second language is (Spanish) correct? I learn French in school, everyone in Canada does.

Read full topic
